His work was mainly about World War II and the Cold War.Biography by Finnish Literature Society The work is anti-war and has dark humor. He was born in Viipuri, Finland. He wrote novels, short stories, poetry, and essays. He was known for his works; Manila rope: A novel, Private Jokinen’s marriage leave and Beneath the Polar Star: Glimpses of Finnish History. He won the Nordic Council's Literature Prize in 1973. Meri died in Helsinki, Finland at the age of 86. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Finnish poets
